structure.unit: B MEDICAL IMAGING, RADIATION THERAPY, AND RELATED OCCUPATIONS

text.section: It is the declared policy of the General Assembly of Kentucky that the practice of medical imaging, radiation therapy, and related occupations should be regulated and controlled as provided by this chapter and by the administrative regulations of the board in order to protect and safeguard the health and safety of the citizens of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Prior to July 12, 2012, the Cabinet for Health and Family Services has exercised effective oversight over the fields of medical imaging and radiation therapy, but it is the intent of the General Assembly that, as of July 12, 2012:
These professions shall be governed by a peer-reviewed, practitioner-based body; and
The board as established in this chapter is the best means to carry out this purpose.

law.history: Created 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 50, sec. 1, effective July 12, 2012.
